abstract: Syrian Observatory for Human Rights releases casualty figures for 2014 in Syria's civil war, reporting that more than 76,000 people died, including 3,500 children; figures, which cannot be independently corroborated, would make 2014 deadliest year since conflict began in 2011 and bring total of number of dead in war to 206,603.
lead_paragraph: Figures compiled by the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights showed that 76,021 people had died in the Syria conflict last year.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut, Lebanon.
byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and MOHAMMAD GHANNAM

snippet: Figures compiled by the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights showed that 76,021 people had died in the Syria conflict last year.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Syria Deaths Hit New High in 2014, Observer Group Says
headline.print_headline: Syria Deaths in 2014 Hit a New High, Group Says
